creator: mmmerchan@hotmail.com
text:
Anybody knows why this error can appear?

2003-09-23 18:42:09 CoyoteAdapter An exception or error occurred in the 
container during the request processing
java.lang.NullPointerException
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardEngineValve.invoke
(StandardEngineValve.java:164)
	at 
org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline$StandardPipelineValveContext.invokeNe
xt(StandardPipeline.java:643)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.StandardPipeline.invoke
(StandardPipeline.java:480)
	at org.apache.catalina.core.ContainerBase.invoke
(ContainerBase.java:995)
	at org.apache.coyote.tomcat4.CoyoteAdapter.service
(CoyoteAdapter.java:223)
	at org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Processor.process
(Http11Processor.java:601)
	at 
org.apache.coyote.http11.Http11Protocol$Http11ConnectionHandler.processConnecti
on(Http11Protocol.java:392)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.net.TcpWorkerThread.runIt
(PoolTcpEndpoint.java:565)
	at org.apache.tomcat.util.threads.ThreadPool$ControlRunnable.run
(ThreadPool.java:619)
	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:536)

Thanks in advance.

I am afraid you haven't provided enough information for me to help you. Some 
idea of what you were actually doing when the exception ocurred would be a 
good start. Have you read http://jakarta.apache.org/tomcat/bugreport.html?

From experience, example configuration files and/or web applications that 
reproduce the problem are particularly helpful.

I am guessing (and with the minimal information provided that is all I can do) 
that this is a configuration issue. I suggest that you would be better off 
asking this question (with som emore information) on the tomcat-user list.
creator: medthomas@ntlworld.com
